title: Introduction
description:
The Hubble API lets you view and manage data like accounts, subscriptions, invoices, transactions, and plans.

The Hubble API is basically a REST API. It has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts form-encoded request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs.

sections.title: Authentication
sections.content:
The Hubble API uses API keys to authenticate requests. It uses bearer authentication for its HTTP authentication scheme. You can view and manage your API keys in the Hubble Console.

API keys provide access to senstivie information. Therefore, be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your API keys in places such as GitHub, client-side code, and so on.

All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

sections.title: Errors
sections.content: The Hubble API uses HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of a request.

sections.title: Pagination
sections.content:
Most resources have support for bulk fetches via "list" API methods. For instance, you can list accounts, list subscriptions, list invoices, and so on. These list API methods share a common structure for requests and responses. The common attributes in responses include:`totalRecords`, `page`, `limit`, `totalPages`, `previousPage`, and `nextPage`.

Simiarly, the common parameters in requests include: `page` and `limit`, based on which Hubble internally implements a cursor based pagination scheme. Further, some endpoints accept optional filters like `dateRange`, `startDate`, `endDate`, and `search`.

items.name: page
items.description: The number of the page you want to retrieve. It is zero based. The first page is at 0, the second at 1, and so on.

items.name: limit
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: page
items.description: The current page number. It is zero based. The first page is at 0, the second at 1, and so on.

items.name: totalRecords
items.description: The total number of records.

items.name: limit
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: totalPages
items.description: The total number of pages based on `limit` and `totalRecords`.

items.name: previousPage
items.description: The previous zero based page number, if any. Otherwise it is `null`.

items.name: nextPage
items.description: The next zero based page number, if any. Otherwise it is `null`.

items.name: records
items.description: An array of records you requested.

title: Accounts
description: The account object represents your customer and stores all their information. You can access other objects such subscriptions, transactions, and invoices through it.

sections.title: Account Object Schema
sections.content: All the account endpoints adhere to the schema described here.

snippets.content:
```json
{
    "id": "5f6190b1966a8f0fd205a00a",
    "subscriptionIds": [],
    "userName": "anushka",
    "firstName": "Anushka",
    "lastName": "Madyanam",
    "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
    "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
    "addressLine1": "Flat 03, JVM Residency",
    "addressLine2": "19th Cross, JS Town",
    "city": "Bengaluru",
    "state": "Karnataka",
    "country": "India",
    "zipCode": "560033",
    "createdAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z",
    "updatedAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z"
}
```

items.name: id
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that uniquely identifies the account across Hubble Subscriptions. It cannot be generated by the client.

items.name: subscriptionIds
items.description: An array of subscription identifiers. Each identifier represents a subscription owned by the account.

items.name: userName
items.description: The user name that uniquely identifies the account across your organization.

items.name: firstName
items.description: The first name of the account holder.

items.name: lastName
items.description: The last name of the account holder.

items.name: emailAddress
items.description: The email address of the account holder.

items.name: phoneNumber
items.description: The phone number of the account holder.

items.name: addressLine1
items.description: The first address line of the account holder.

items.name: addressLine2
items.description: The second address line of the account holder.

items.name: city
items.description: The city of the account holder.

items.name: state
items.description: The state of the account holder.

items.name: country
items.description: The country of the account holder.

items.name: zipCode
items.description: The zip code of the account holder.

items.name: createdAt
items.description: The time when the account was created, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: updatedAt
items.description: The time when the account was last updated, expressed in UTC format.

title: Subscriptions
description: A subscription represents an arrangement for regular payments. Basically, it is an association between a plan and an account, where the plan tells Hubble Subscriptions how much to bill the customer.

sections.title: Subscription Object Schema
sections.content: All the subscription endpoints adhere to the schema described here.

snippets.content:
```json
{
    "id": "5f6190b1966a8f0fd205a00a",
    "subscriptionIds": [],
    "userName": "anushka",
    "firstName": "Anushka",
    "lastName": "Madyanam",
    "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
    "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
    "addressLine1": "Flat 03, JVM Residency",
    "addressLine2": "19th Cross, JS Town",
    "city": "Bengaluru",
    "state": "Karnataka",
    "country": "India",
    "zipCode": "560033",
    "createdAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z",
    "updatedAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z"
}
```

items.name: id
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that uniquely identifies the subscription across Hubble Subscriptions. It cannot be generated by the client.

items.name: ownerId
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that identifies the organization that owns the subscription.

items.name: planId
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that identifies the associated plan.

items.name: accountId
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that identifies the associated account.

items.name: quantity
items.description: The quantity of service given to the customer.

items.name: billingPeriod
items.description: The billing period.

items.name: billingPeriodUnit
items.description: The unit of the billing period.

items.name: setupFee
items.description: The initial fee charged at the beginning of the subscription.

items.name: trialPeriod
items.description: The trial period.

items.name: trialPeriodUnit
items.description: The unit of the trial period.

items.name: term
items.description: The term.

items.name: termUnit
items.description: The unit of the term.

items.name: renews
items.description: Determines whether the subscription will be renewed or expired after the term ends.

items.name: startsAt
items.description: The requested time when the subscription starts, expressed in UTC format. This attribute is a guideline to Hubble. The actual activation time may be delayed by a few seconds to minutes.

items.name: activatedAt
items.description: The time when Hubble activated the subscription, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: cancelledAt
items.description: The time when the subscription was canclled, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: pausedAt
items.description: The time when the subscription was paused, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: currentPeriodStart
items.description: The time when the current period started, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: currentPeriodEnd
items.description: The time when the current period ends, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: createdAt
items.description: The time when the subscription was created, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: updatedAt
items.description: The time when the subscription was last updated, expressed in UTC format.

title: Transactions
description: A transaction includes the billing information of a customer and the amount of money to be charged, voided, or refunded.

sections.title: Transaction Object Schema
sections.content: All the transaction endpoints adhere to the schema described here.

items.name: id
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that uniquely identifies the transaction across Hubble Subscriptions. It cannot be generated by the client.

items.name: amount
items.description: The amount of money involved in this transaction.

items.name: tax
items.description: The tax applied to this transaction.

items.name: comments
items.description: The comments on this transaction.

items.name: action
items.description: Type type of transaction. It can be one of: `purchase`, `refund`, and `verify`.

items.name: referenceId
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that identifies the object associated with this transaction.

items.name: paymentMethod
items.description: The payment method used to transact the money. It can be one of: `cash`, `credit_card`, `debit_card`, and `online`.

items.name: createdAt
items.description: The time when the transaction was created, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: updatedAt
items.description: The time when the transaction was last updated, expressed in UTC format.

title: Plans
description: A plan is a blueprint for a subscription. It tells Hubble how often and how much to charge your subscribers. Plans can include free trials, add-ons, setup fees, and much more.

sections.title: Plan Object Schema
sections.content: All the plan endpoints adhere to the schema described here.

items.name: id
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that uniquely identifies the plan across Hubble Subscriptions. It cannot be generated by the client.

items.name: name
items.description: The name of the plan.

items.name: code
items.description: The code name of the plan. It should be unique within your organization.

items.name: description
items.description: A brief description of the plan.

items.name: billingPeriod
items.description: The billing period of the plan.

items.name: billingPeriodUnit
items.description: The unit of the billing period.

items.name: pricePerBillingPeriod
items.description: The price charged per billing period.

items.name: setupFee
items.description: The initial fee charged at the beginning of the subscription.

items.name: trialPeriod
items.description: The trial period.

items.name: trialPeriodUnit
items.description: The unit of the trial period.

items.name: term
items.description: The term of the subscription.

items.name: termUnit
items.description: The unit of the term.

items.name: renews
items.description: Determines whether the subscription will be renewed or expired after the term ends.

items.name: createdAt
items.description: The time when the plan was created, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: updatedAt
items.description: The time when the plan was last updated, expressed in UTC format.
